Package be.helha.api_recettapp.services

Class KeycloakUserService

java.lang.Object
be.helha.api_recettapp.services.KeycloakUserService
@Service public class KeycloakUserService extends Object
Service class for managing Keycloak users. This service interacts with the Keycloak Admin API to perform administrative operations such as blocking and unblocking users in a specified realm. It uses @Service annotation to mark this class as a Spring service component.

  • Method Details

    • getKeycloakInstance

      public org.keycloak.admin.client.Keycloak getKeycloakInstance()
      Creates and configures a Keycloak instance for interacting with the Keycloak Admin API. The Keycloak instance is initialized with the admin user's credentials and connects to the specified server and realm.
      Returns:
      A Keycloak instance.

    • blockUser

      public void blockUser(String email)
      Disables (blocks) a user in Keycloak. This method fetches the user by his email from the specified realm and disables his account.
      Parameters:
      email - The email of the user to block.

    • unblockUser

      public void unblockUser(String email)
      Enables (unblocks) a user in Keycloak. This method fetches the user by his email from the specified realm and enables his account.
      Parameters:
      email - The email of the user to unblock.

    • deleteUser

      public void deleteUser(String email)
      Deletes a user in Keycloak. This method fetches the user by their email from the specified realm and deletes their account.
      Parameters:
      email - The email of the user to delete.

    • listUsers

      public List<org.keycloak.representations.idm.UserRepresentation> listUsers()
      Retrieves a list of all users in the specified Keycloak realm, along with their associated roles.

      This method interacts with the Keycloak server to fetch all users in the realm. For each user, it retrieves their roles at the realm level and adds these roles as a list of strings to the user's attributes.

      The roles are extracted from the Keycloak server and mapped into a list of role names, which are then set as an attribute in each user's UserRepresentation object under the key "roles".

      Returns:
      a List of UserRepresentation objects, each containing user details along with their associated roles.
